posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
So is this targeted for a Level 40 build?

More levels in shifter really only increases things like breath weapon and Rak ice storms (besides access to the improved forms and durations, that is).

It would probably help to know what you get from that custom class, like feats or other benefits.

You should decide which form you will likely specialize in and then work backwards to enhance it the best you can. If, say, you got Undead Shape @shifter 10 and stopped there, you'd have 20 left for "other". If you can get druid to at least 13 you'll begin to get some nice buffs like Aura of Vitality and they get even better ones with more druid levels (and the durations, of course). So, a Risen Lord split might be something like custom 10/shifter 10/druid 20 which would give access to all spells though the buffs would be dispelled pretty easily. If you just want the ability to cast level 9 spells, you'd end up with a split more like custom 10/shifter 13/druid 17. In either case, you'd probably want Extend and Empower thrown in there along with Expertise (and Imp Expertise, if there is room) for the breath weapons and or if you decide to elect Outsider Shape @WIS 25 perhaps Rak Ice Storms.

It's a tough call with that 10-level deficit from the custom class. Normally, with that many levels in any class one would expect it to become the dominant class but I really know little about it so can't venture on how to exploit it better.
